article_title: French Railway Disappointed by German Unit, FT Deutschland Says
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"LS4A810YHQ0X01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2011-09-26/french-railway-disappointed-by-german-unit-ft-deutschland-says"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-1MoxQH6"}   Societe Nationale de Chemins de Fer Francais is unhappy with the performance of its German subsidiary Keolis, Financial Times Deutschland reported, citing an interview with SNCF executive Jean-Pierre Farandou.    Keolis, which runs trains in the states of North Rhine-Westphalia and Hesse, accounts for less than 1 percent of Germany’s 8 billion-euro ($10.7 billion) regional-railway market, FT Deutschland reported. Farandou ruled out the French railway division’s departure from Germany as well as any acquisitions, saying he expects Keolis to grow by taking over more train-route franchises, the newspaper said.
